intro: Pavetta camerounensis, commonly known as Cameroon pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases small seeds when mature, aiding in its dispersal.
